010package imagingbook.common.math;
011
012import static org.apache.commons.math3.util.FastMath.abs;
013import static org.apache.commons.math3.util.FastMath.atan2;
014import static org.apache.commons.math3.util.FastMath.cos;
015import static org.apache.commons.math3.util.FastMath.floor;
016import static org.apache.commons.math3.util.FastMath.floorMod;
017import static org.apache.commons.math3.util.FastMath.hypot;
018import static org.apache.commons.math3.util.FastMath.sin;
019
020/**
021 * This class defines static methods implementing arithmetic operations and predicates.
022 * 
023 * @author WB
024 *
025 */
026public abstract class Arithmetic {
027        
028        private Arithmetic() {}
029        
030        // machine accuracy for IEEE 754 float/double;
031        /** Default tolerance used for comparing {@code float} quantities. */
032        public static final float EPSILON_FLOAT = 1e-7f;        // 1.19 x 10^-7
033        /** Default tolerance used for comparing {@code double} quantities. */
034        public static final double EPSILON_DOUBLE = 2e-16;      // 2.22 x 10^-16
035
036        /**
037         * Returns the square of its argument.
038         * @param x argument
039         * @return square of argument
040         */
041        public static int sqr(int x) {
042                return x * x;
043        }
044        
045        /**
046         * Returns the square of its argument.
047         * @param x argument
048         * @return square of argument
049         */
050        public static long sqr(long x) {
051                return x * x;
052        }
053        
054        /**
055         * Returns the square of its argument.
056         * @param x argument
057         * @return square of argument
058         */
059        public static float sqr(float x) {
060                return x * x;
061        }
062        
063        /**
064         * Returns the square of its argument.
065         * @param x argument
066         * @return square of argument
067         */
068        public static double sqr(double x) {
069                return x * x;
070        }
071        
072        /**
073         * Returns the radius of the Cartesian point 
074         * @param x x-component
075         * @param y y-component
076         * @return the radius
077         */
078        public static double radius(double x, double y) {
079                return hypot(x, y);
080        }
081        
082        /**
083         * Returns the angle of the Cartesian point (x,y)
084         * @param x x-component
085         * @param y y-component
086         * @return the angle
087         */
088        public static double angle(double x, double y) {
089                return atan2(y, x);
090        }
091        
092        /**
093         * Returns the polar coordinates of the Cartesian point (x,y).
094         * @param x x-component
095         * @param y y-component
096         * @return a 2-element array holding the polar coordinates (radius, angle)
097         */
098        public static double[] toPolar(double x, double y) {
099                return new double[] {hypot(x, y), atan2(y, x)};
100        }
101        
102        /**
103         * Returns the polar coordinates of the Cartesian point xy.
104         * @param xy the Cartesian coordinates
105         * @return a 2-element array holding the polar coordinates (radius, angle)
106         */
107        public static double[] toPolar(double[] xy) {
108                return toPolar(xy[0], xy[1]);
109        }
110        
111        /**
112         * Converts polar point coordinates to Cartesian coordinates.
113         * @param radius the radius 
114         * @param angle the angle
115         * @return a 2-element array holding the Cartesian coordinates (x,y)
116         */
117        public static double[] toCartesian(double radius, double angle) {
118                return new double[] {radius * cos(angle), radius * sin(angle)};
119        }
120        
121        /**
122         * Converts polar point coordinates to Cartesian coordinates.
123         * @param polar the polar coordinates (radius, angle)
124         * @return a 2-element array holding the Cartesian coordinates (x,y)
125         */
126        public static double[] toCartesian(double[] polar) {
127                return toCartesian(polar[0], polar[1]);
128        }
129        
130        /**
131         * Integer version of the modulus operator ({@code a mod b}).
132         * Also see <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Modulo_operation">here</a>.
133         * Calls {@code Math.floorMod(a,b)} (available in Java 8 and higher).
134         * @param a dividend
135         * @param b divisor (modulus), must be nonzero
136         * @return {@code a mod b}
137         */
138        public static int mod(int a, int b) {
139                return floorMod(a, b);
140        }
141        
142        // original implementation (obsolete)
143//      public static int mod(int a, int b) {
144//              if (b == 0)
145//                      return a;
146//              // a, b have the same sign OR the remainder is zero
147//        if ((long)a * b >= 0 || a % b == 0)   // or (a / b) * b == a
148//              return a - b * (a / b);
149//        else
150//              return a - b * (a / b - 1);
151//      }
152
153        
154        /**
155         * Non-integer version of modulus operator using floored division
156         * (see <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Modulo_operation">here</a>),
157         * with results identical to Mathematica. 
158         * Calculates {@code a mod b} for floating-point arguments.
159         * An exception is thrown if  {@code b} is zero.
160         * Examples:
161         * <pre>
162         * mod( 3.5, 2.1) =  1.4
163         * mod(-3.5, 2.1) =  0.7
164         * mod( 3.5,-2.1) = -0.7
165         * mod(-3.5,-2.1) = -1.4</pre>
166         * 
167         * @param a dividend
168         * @param b divisor (modulus), must be nonzero
169         * @return {@code a mod b}
170         */
171        public static double mod(double a, double b) {
172                if (isZero(b))
173                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("zero modulus in mod");
174                return a - b * floor(a / b);
175        }
176        
177        /**
178         * Test for zero (float version) using a predefined tolerance.
179         * Returns true if the argument's absolute value
180         * is less than {@link EPSILON_FLOAT}.
181         * @param x quantity to be tested
182         * @return true if argument is close to zero
183         */
184        public static boolean isZero(float x) {
185                return abs(x) < EPSILON_FLOAT;
186        }
187        
188        /**
189         * Test for zero (float version) using a specified tolerance.
190         * Returns true if the argument's absolute value
191         * is less than the specified tolerance.
192         * @param x quantity to be tested
193         * @param tolerance the tolerance to be used
194         * @return true if argument is close to zero
195         */
196        public static boolean isZero(float x, float tolerance) {
197                return abs(x) < tolerance;
198        }
199        
200        /**
201         * Test for zero (double version) using a predefined tolerance.
202         * Returns true if the argument's absolute value
203         * is less than {@link EPSILON_DOUBLE}.
204         * @param x quantity to be tested
205         * @return true if argument is close to zero
206         */
207        public static boolean isZero(double x) {
208                return abs(x) < EPSILON_DOUBLE;
209        }
210        
211        /**
212         * Test for zero (double version) using a specified tolerance.
213         * Returns true if the argument's absolute value
214         * is less than the specified tolerance.
215         * @param x quantity to be tested
216         * @param tolerance the tolerance to be used
217         * @return true if argument is close to zero
218         */
219        public static boolean isZero(double x, double tolerance) {
220                return abs(x) < tolerance;
221        }
222        
223        /**
224         * Test for numerical equality (double version) using the default tolerance.
225         * Returns true if the absolute difference of the arguments
226         * is less than {@link EPSILON_DOUBLE}.
227         * @param x first argument
228         * @param y second argument
229         * @return true if the absolute difference of the arguments is less than the tolerance
230         */
231        public static boolean equals(double x, double y) {
232                return isZero(x - y);
233        }
234        
235        /**
236         * Test for numerical equality (double version) using a specific tolerance.
237         * @param x first argument
238         * @param y second argument
239         * @param tolerance the maximum (absolute) deviation
240         * @return true if the absolute difference of the arguments is less than the tolerance
241         */
242        public static boolean equals(double x, double y, double tolerance) {
243                return isZero(x - y, tolerance);
244        }
245        
246        /**
247         * Test for numerical equality (float version) using the default tolerance.
248         * Returns true if the absolute difference of the arguments
249         * is less than {@link EPSILON_FLOAT}.
250         * @param x first argument
251         * @param y second argument
252         * @return true if the absolute difference of the arguments is less than the tolerance
253         */
254        public static boolean equals(float x, float y) {
255                return isZero(x - y);
256        }
257        
258        /**
259         * Test for numerical equality (float version) using a specific tolerance.
260         * @param x first argument
261         * @param y second argument
262         * @param tolerance the maximum (absolute) deviation
263         * @return true if the absolute difference of the arguments is less than the tolerance
264         */
265        public static boolean equals(float x, float y, float tolerance) {
266                return isZero(x - y, tolerance);
267        }
268        
269        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
270        
271        /**
272         * Returns the maximum of one or more integer values.
273         * @param a the first value
274         * @param vals more values
275         * @return the maximum value
276         */
277        public static int max(int a, int... vals) {
278                int maxVal = a;
279                for (int v : vals) {
280                        if (v > maxVal) {
281                                maxVal = v;
282                        }
283                }
284                return maxVal;
285        }
286        
287        /**
288         * Returns the minimum of one or more integer values.
289         * @param a the first value
290         * @param vals more values
291         * @return the minimum value
292         */
293        public static int min(int a, int... vals) {
294                int minVal = a;
295                for (int v : vals) {
296                        if (v < minVal) {
297                                minVal = v;
298                        }
299                }
300                return minVal;
301        }
302        
303        /**
304         * Returns the maximum of one or more float values.
305         * @param a the first value
306         * @param vals more values
307         * @return the maximum value
308         */
309        public static float max(float a, float... vals) {
310                float maxVal = a;
311                for (float v : vals) {
312                        if (v > maxVal) {
313                                maxVal = v;
314                        }
315                }
316                return maxVal;
317        }
318        
319        /**
320         * Returns the minimum of one or more float values.
321         * @param a the first value
322         * @param vals more values
323         * @return the minimum value
324         */
325        public static float min(float a, float... vals) {
326                float minVal = a;
327                for (float v : vals) {
328                        if (v < minVal) {
329                                minVal = v;
330                        }
331                }
332                return minVal;
333        }
334        
335        /**
336         * Returns the maximum of one or more double values.
337         * @param a the first value
338         * @param vals more values
339         * @return the maximum value
340         */
341        public static double max(double a, double... vals) {
342                double maxVal = a;
343                for (double v : vals) {
344                        if (v > maxVal) {
345                                maxVal = v;
346                        }
347                }
348                return maxVal;
349        }
350        
351        /**
352         * Returns the minimum of one or more double values.
353         * @param a the first value
354         * @param vals more values
355         * @return the minimum value
356         */
357        public static double min(double a, double... vals) {
358                double minVal = a;
359                for (double v : vals) {
360                        if (v < minVal) {
361                                minVal = v;
362                        }
363                }
364                return minVal;
365        }
366        
367        /**
368         * Limits the first argument to the clipping interval specified by the two other
369         * arguments ({@code double} version). The clipped value is returned. Throws an
370         * exception if the clipping interval is empty.
371         * 
372         * @param x    the value to be clipped
373         * @param low  the lower boundary of the clipping interval
374         * @param high the upper boundary of the clipping interval
375         * @return the clipped value
376         */
377        public static double clipTo(double x, double low, double high) {
378                if (low > high) {
379                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("clip interval low > high");
380                }
381                if (x < low) return low;
382                if (x > high) return high;
383                return x;
384        }
385        
386        /**
387         * Limits the first argument to the clipping interval specified by the two other
388         * arguments ({@code float} version). The clipped value is returned. Throws an
389         * exception if the clipping interval is empty.
390         * 
391         * @param x    the value to be clipped
392         * @param low  the lower boundary of the clipping interval
393         * @param high the upper boundary of the clipping interval
394         * @return the clipped value
395         */
396        public static float clipTo(float x, float low, float high) {
397                if (low > high) {
398                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("clip interval low > high");
399                }
400                if (x < low) return low;
401                if (x > high) return high;
402                return x;
403        }
404        
405        /**
406         * Limits the first argument to the clipping interval specified by the two other
407         * arguments ({@code float} version). The clipped value is returned. Throws an
408         * exception if the clipping interval is empty.
409         * 
410         * @param x    the value to be clipped
411         * @param low  the lower boundary of the clipping interval
412         * @param high the upper boundary of the clipping interval
413         * @return the clipped value
414         */
415        public static int clipTo(int x, int low, int high) {
416                if (low > high) {
417                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("clip interval low > high");
418                }
419                if (x < low) return low;
420                if (x > high) return high;
421                return x;
422        }
423        
424        /**
425         * Returns the two real roots of the quadratic function
426         * f(x) = ax^2 + bx + c.
427         * Null is returned if roots are non-real.
428         * @param a function coefficient
429         * @param b function coefficient
430         * @param c function coefficient
431         * @return an array with the two roots x1, x2 (in no particular order) or null if the function has complex roots
432         */
433        public static double[] getRealRoots(double a, double b, double c) {
434                double d = sqr(b) - 4 * a * c;
435                if (d < 0) {
436                        return null;    // complex roots
437                }
438                double dr = Math.sqrt(d);       
439                double x1 = (-b - dr) / (2 * a);
440                double x2 = (-b + dr) / (2 * a);
441                return new double[] {x1, x2};
442        }
443
444}
